title: It seems like Star Guardians share the same universe with Project and Mecha skins
body:
https://youtu.be/5pYznHqxkeQ?t=3m53s

Star Guardian Jinx taunts Project and Mecha skin lines, which implies they all exist in the same universe.

The only question is the state of Battlecast skins, which right now seem like the alpha series that paved the way for both PROJECT and Mecha line. But one peculiar thing remains:

#Champions can only belong to one of these groups.

**Star Guardians**
{{champion:99}} {{champion:222}} {{champion:40}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:78}} 

**Mecha**
{{champion:14}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:121}} {{champion:266}} 

**PROJECT**
{{champion:157}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:236}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:22}} {{champion:245}} {{champion:55}} 

Now, my theory here would be that other skin lines might share that universe:

**Super Galaxy**
{{champion:68}} {{champion:102}} {{champion:203}} {{champion:105}} (Fizz, his icon is broken on boards now)

**Dark Star**
{{champion:412}} {{champion:110}} 

**Battlecast**
{{champion:112}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:101}} {{champion:6}} {{champion:161}} {{champion:96}} {{champion:72}} 

**Full Metal**
{{champion:126}} {{champion:80}} {{champion:33}} 

I'm not so sure on Battlecast and Fullmetal, because it's an old skin line (they are confirmed to be shared as a vision of future in which Viktor and Jayce mechanize their allies), but the fact remains that none of the Battlecast/Fullmetal champions have any skins belonging to other lines. Mostly because they and Mecha are thematically pretty much the same thing.

---

So, we got a bunch of champions (23% of the total pool) divided into separate skin lines. What other evidence supports the theory that Star Guardian and Super Galaxy belong in the same universe?

http://i.imgur.com/83YSxNZ.jpg

#It's all anime as fuck.

Seriously. I don't think you need to even watch any single anime to realize there's something thematically coherent in the way Star Guardians and Super Galaxy skins are portrayed. And if Jinx calls out PROJECT and Mechas, it's no longer a reference to just Transformers or Pacific Rim (let's ignore these two ones were heavily anime-referenced) - we're blending several seemingly faraway concepts (robots and magic) into one reality.

Then, if you do have any anime knowledge, you begin noticing all the Madoka/Pretty Cure references in Star Guardian skin line (Sailor Moon is a reference even people who haven't seen a single anime in their life get), you realize Super Galaxy Rumble is a one big tribute to Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann, and you notice how Mecha Malphite was supposed to be a reference to EVA (if only the skin itself was as epic as its splash).

Dark Star isn't a big skin line yet, but I'm banking on it being too thematically related to Star Guardians to not be connected in any means.

http://i.imgur.com/RtWlxSf.jpg

---

What's your opinion on this approach? Personally, I love it. I always like when you can match skins in your team, and I'm quite upset when a promising skin line is discontinued (like Crimson Elite was).

Also, do you have any good ideas on what champions unassigned to any of these groups yet should get a certain type of skin? And how should be this shared universe called, "superworld", "animeverse", "weebout"?

replies.body:
Rito should give the rights for the anime to a good japanese studio already. Like the one that created attack on titan. They had nothing to do this year and made _kabaneri of the iron fortress_ which while had shallow plot, the animation was excellent and quite enjoyable. Imagine if they bothered with a LoL anime. The success would be massive.

It would really profit both parties. Rito because it would be free advertising and prob money from rights. And lets not mention the best preview for future skins.
The studio because it will go into a topic with great fanbase, that would lead to even greater viewership. Even people not particulary interested in both, would watch it because of the hype.
It is like the case of Warhammer:Total war. It lead to the reborn of total war series not only because it drafted from both fanbases, but also outsiders that were curious about the collaboration.

The only obstacle would be if it would fit Riots view of that alternative universe. It would require a decent cooperation beween lore team and the studio to produce the raw storyline.

I think that these skin lines, while having the potential to exist in the same universe, probably don't in most cases. In any case I certainly don't want Riot to beholden to the idea that if a champion has one skin they can't have another, providing those skin lines don't conflict too much. Kha'Zix not having a Battlecast skin because it could be far too similar to Mecha makes sense, but I'd hate to see Jinx or Poppy get denied potential PROJECT skins because they have Star Guardian skins.

The reason there's likely little overlap currently is because skin lines are generally made with some design decisions from the get go, and we're not at a point yet where skin lines are fleshed out in terms of quantity. Some examples:

PROJECT: Human champions only
MECHA: Humanoid/Unusual Human champions only
Battlecast: Monster champions only
Star Guardian: Young human women/yordle women only

The boundaries are only just being explored so overlap has yet to occur. Having skin lines in the same universe would be interesting in my opinion, but I don't want things to be set in stone just yet. Having a bit of ambiguity in that regard helps to build up the potential for later.

But that is a part of why this design is so genius. You don't forbid champions from "joining" a skin line - they're deliberately designed in a way that makes every champion "fit" into one of them.

And if they could fit into different styles, you just make a skin for them that's separate from the animeverse. For example Lux has a Steel Legion skin that makes pretty much any PROJECT design redundant, yet it's significantly different from that line. Poppy admittedly could work in the PROJECT line but that demand can be met with another Steel Legion skin to match Lux and Garen.

But in that case they specifically don't get to make one skin of a specific theme because it's part of a singular skin universe and deliberately have to choose a different skin line. That's what I DON'T want to see. That effectively kills the creativity by setting up the arbitrary measure of "skin can't be made because skin lore". Clashing aesthetics is a major thing and I respect that when they design skins, but deliberately saying we'll make X skin and not Y skin because of an alternate universe seems super restricting and not fun at all.

If this animeverse means any champion can denied access to a new skin, and the ONLY REASON WHY is because of that AU's existence, then it's a major negative as far as I can see.

You say that having skin lines in the same universe could be inhibitory, but I disagree. This "universe" can have a timeline, it is not just a singular picture. Story arcs develop, things change. 

For example, poppy could originally be a part of the star guardian line, before she is taken and turned into a project character (I personally do not believe these to be the same universes, but it is possible).

Literally the only thing that surprises me is that they didnt go for the Star Guardian Ahri. that things weeb sale levels would be so high it'd resurrect a certain DBZ meme! 
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

Star Guardian Jinx will never insult the size of your penis while she steps on it with her sock-clad foot.

Why live?

I personally don't think they all share the same universe with Star Guardians, especially the Project/Mecha/Battlecast ones, since the world they exist in are very different. Project is some kind of future cyber-punk setting, Battlecast looks like the world from the Machines from Matrix, and Mecha seems to be a not-so-very-far future (~100 years from our pov), as it is in Pacific Rim.
Though I can't tell about Dark Star and Super Galaxy, although the latter has, just like the Star Guardians a heavy anime theme, one Skin line I can see exist in the same universe is the Academy one. If you look at the Star Guardian comic, they wear very similar clothes to Ahris in the 'school-picture'.

Also I think Project, Battlecast, Mecha and Dark Star are way too dark a theme for Star Guardian and Super Galaxy
Yeah, I wouldn't be surprised if we see, like, Academy Ahri in the background of some Star Guardian art.

PROJECT, Mecha, and Battlecast are indeed part of the same Universe (Battlecast units found in splash arts of PROJECT skins, and both Mecha and PROJECT being inspired by Viktors Evolution...and thematically they all fit nicely into that dystopian alternate future vibe), let call it Universe B (since Universe A is the main timeline of LoL). Star Guardians are part of Universe C, but due to the nature of their powers, they are able to traverse multiple universes and dimensions, making the connection possible the same way Bard traverses plains of existence.

Currently, there are no indications if Dark Star or Super Galaxy skins fit in Universe C, but thematically they make sense in it just as the ones in Universe B fit inside that universe.

Additionally, Program, Full Metal, Steel Legion, and Pulsefire skin themes could potentially fit in Universe B, but few or any proof could indicate the truth of that outcome as of this time.


Also skin lore doesnt deter potential new skins being created for champions that already had skins in the same universe, in fact, the way each theme was handled, there are multiple ways of creating new skins for the same character within the same multiverse (specially since some of these skins arent the real characters we see, rather their mecha, robot, cosmic versions of what we would closely associate any given characters with, not actual character if he was in that setting at that time).
